intro: Oreogrammitis meijer-dreesii, commonly known as the Meijer-Dreesii wall-rue, is a fern native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows on rocks or tree trunks in shaded, humid environments. Its leaves are usually small and closely arranged, forming a dense, carpet-like appearance. Oreogrammitis meijer-dreesii is often found in moist, tropical or subtropical regions where it thrives in humid, shaded conditions.
